Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the web application, including hosting needs, supported frameworks, and integration with APIs or backend services.
Design the architecture for the static web app, including folder structure, build pipelines, and integration points with Azure Functions or APIs.
Create a GitHub repository for the web application codebase. Ensure proper branching strategies and permissions are in place.
Provision a new Azure Static Web App resource in the Azure portal or using CLI/PowerShell. Link it to the GitHub repository for CI/CD integration.
Set up build and deployment settings in the Azure portal, including specifying the build folder, API location, and output folder.
Enable security features such as custom domains with HTTPS, authentication providers, and role-based access control (RBAC) for the web app.
Perform testing of the deployed application to ensure functionality, performance, and security. Validate integration with APIs and backend services.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the web app using Azure Monitor and Application Insights. Configure alerts for performance metrics and errors.
Create detailed documentation for the application setup, including architecture, deployment settings, and operational procedures.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Azure Static Web App setup.
Ensure the web app setup adheres to organizational and regulatory compliance requirements. Conduct periodic audits to verify compliance.
Use Azure Monitor and Application Insights to continuously track the performance of the Static Web App, including response times, error rates, and user interactions.
Regularly review and update the dependencies used in the Static Web App to ensure compatibility, security, and performance improvements.
Conduct security audits to identify vulnerabilities in the Static Web App, including reviewing authentication mechanisms and access controls.
Ensure regular backups of the Static Web App configuration, including routing rules, authentication settings, and environment variables.
Verify the functionality of the CI/CD pipeline used for deploying the Static Web App to ensure smooth and error-free deployments.
Check the configuration of custom domains associated with the Static Web App to ensure proper DNS settings and SSL certificate validity.
Analyze performance metrics and implement optimizations, such as reducing asset sizes, enabling caching, and improving load times.
Regularly test authentication and authorization mechanisms to ensure secure access to the Static Web App.
Perform failover tests to ensure the Static Web App can recover from outages or disruptions without data loss or service downtime.
Review and update environment variables used in the Static Web App to ensure they are correctly configured and secure.
Evaluate the SLA performance of Azure Static Web Apps to ensure compliance with uptime and performance guarantees.
Gather and analyze user feedback to identify areas for improvement in the Static Web App's functionality and performance.
